title: Holistic Student Formation Through Online Theological Education: A Study Based on Asynchronous Microlearning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic theological concepts and proficiency in online learning tools
context.additional_context: Implementation of an asynchronous online learning environment in theological education that integrates knowledge, skills, reflection, and moral judgment. Project-based assessment measures learnersâ€™ practical growth

learning_goals: Learners can complete at least three reflective practice projects applying theological knowledge to real-world problems.
Demonstrate collaborative reflective skills with peer learners through online discussions and feedback activities, achieving over 80% participation.
Enhance self-reflection skills by documenting and sharing theological insights acquired through weekly microlearning modules on a personal blog at least 10 times.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
